title: embedding
description: Generation of cell embeddings for the integration of single cell transcriptomic count data using scGPT.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input h5mu file containing tokenized gene and count data
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input h5mu file containing tokenized gene and count data.

model.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. Path to scGPT model file
model.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. Path to scGPT model file.

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Path to scGPT model vocabulary file
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Path to scGPT model vocabulary file.

model_config.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. Path to scGPT model config file
model_config.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. Path to scGPT model config file.

obsm_gene_tokens.description: Type: `string`, default: `gene_id_tokens`, example: `values.pt`. The key of the
obsm_gene_tokens.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `gene_id_tokens`, example: `values.pt`. The key of the .obsm array containing the gene token ids

obsm_tokenized_values.description: Type: `string`, default: `values_tokenized`. The key of the
obsm_tokenized_values.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `values_tokenized`. The key of the .obsm array containing the count values of the tokenized genes

obsm_padding_mask.description: Type: `string`, default: `padding_mask`. The key of the
obsm_padding_mask.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `padding_mask`. The key of the .obsm array containing the padding mask.

var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the .var column containing gene names. When no gene_name_layer is provided, the .var index will be used.

obs_batch_label.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata
obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata.obs column containing the batch labels. Must be provided when 'dsbn' is set to True.

finetuned_checkpoints_key.description: Type: `string`, example: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model file containing the pretrained checkpoints
finetuned_checkpoints_key.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model file containing the pretrained checkpoints. Only relevant for fine-tuned models.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Path to output anndata file containing pre-processed data as well as scGPT embeddings
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Path to output anndata file containing pre-processed data as well as scGPT embeddings.

obsm_embeddings.description: Type: `string`, default: `X_scGPT`. The name of the adata
obsm_embeddings.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_scGPT`. The name of the adata.obsm array to which scGPT embeddings will be written.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects
output_compression.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects.
By default no compression is applied.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The token to be used for padding
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The token to be used for padding.

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token.

dsbn.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to apply domain-specific batch normalization for generating embeddings
dsbn.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to apply domain-specific batch normalization for generating embeddings. When set to True, 'obs_batch_labels' must be set as well.

batch_size.description: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for inference
batch_size.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for inference

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
